metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1670 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw use after free in the Linux kernel Xircom 16-bit PCMCIA (PC-card) Ethernet driver was found.A local user could use this flaw to crash the system or potentially escalate their privileges on the system. It was discovered that the Xircom PCMCIA network device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle device removal events. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1670` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-aws - 4.4.0-1118.124
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-lowlatency - 4.4.0-240.274~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-lowlatency - 4.4.0-240.274~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> for exploitation, requires PCMCIA device detachment to occur, i.e. physical access

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1118.124').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-240.274~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-240.274~14.04.1').
